thread.title: Calvin Pace: Toilet paper proves Jets are NFL’s ‘best organization’
thread.title_full: Calvin Pace: Toilet paper proves Jets are NFL’s ‘best organization’ | New York Post

author: Brian Costello
title: Calvin Pace: Toilet paper proves Jets are NFL’s ‘best organization’
text:
LONDON — Calvin Pace says he has unraveled evidence about the NFL’s classiest franchise: It’s right there in the two-ply.
The veteran linebacker got on a roll Friday discussing the extra lengths the Jets went to in accommodating the team on its trip to London for Sunday’s far-away game against the Miami Dolphins, including importing “ 350 rolls of toilet paper to replace the thinner version used in England,” as reported by The New York Times.
“We’re the best organization in football, man,” Pace said Friday. “Sometimes you guys write articles about us that don’t say that, but this place, they’ll do anything for you. I mean, who brings toilet paper? Little things like that make your trip easier. It’s a good thing for us. If it helps us win, I’m all for it.”
He hadn’t availed himself of the durable American cloth since Thursday night’s arrival.
“No, not yet — maybe when I get back [to the hotel],” Pace said. “At least I know I’ll have some familiar toilet paper.”
But Nick Mangold isn’t sure toilet paper was a necessary item on the packing list, which also included hot sauce, more than 300 electrical adapters and a set of giveaway keychains, according to the Times report.
The first question Mangold received from a British reporter Friday was if he used the local toilet paper on a July promotional trip across the pond. He said he had and had no issues.
